issue.title: Merge config from an environment variable
issue.body:
The configuration used after startup should

* come from the configuration file
* possibly superseded by flags from the commandline
* possibly superseded by options from the environment

Configuration via an environment variable allows one to easily set configurations without touching any other files (e.g. set via .zlogin instead of modifying a git-tracked dotfile).

body: This would be indeed awesome - I'd love to have a cmd alias/key binding with which I could toggle dark/light colorschemes in a running terminal.
@varac fwiw you can do this quite easy with shell scripts + live_config_reload atm.

@kchibisov But that means that I need to change the config, and new instances of alacritty would use the modified config when starting - this is not what I want (even if this workaround is better than nothing). Or do I get this wrong ?

Is there an example in the docs how to do that ?

> Is there an example in the docs how to do that ?

Configurations are reloaded by default. You do this simply by editing the configuration file. It's enabled by default.
You can also just send a proper escapes, so it’ll update only one instance at the time.

> You can also just send a proper escapes, so it’ll update only one instance at the time.

Sorry I don't understand what you mean ?

You can use something like this `printf "\033]4;0;#ffffff\007"` to change your black color, where 0 - is a color index iirc, so 0-15 should change default colors. This one is for the foreground color: `printf "\033]10;#00ff00\007"` and to change the background color you need to replace `10` with `11`, `12` is for cursor (don't work when your cursor is set to be inverted though).

Update: fyi `reset` resets things to normal, just reminding.
For easy `alacritty.yml` colorscheme manipulation you can try this [approach](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/wiki/Color-schemes#multiple-schemes)

@kchibisov @chrisduerr Thx for helping, I settled with `live_config_reload` for now.
I'm using the [multiple color scheme approach](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/wiki/Color-schemes#multiple-schemes) and have these aliases to easily toggle between dark and light color scheme:

```
alias light="sed -i 's/colors: \*dark/colors: *light/' ~/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml"
alias  dark="sed -i 's/colors: \*light/colors: *dark/' ~/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml"
```

> How does this work with multiple alacritty instances? Surely toggling to light on one process will cause all other processes to toggle as well?

@64 Yes, it toggles all alacritty terminals at once.
You could work around this by spawning a new config for each Alacritty instance. Copying from the default location. That would certainly work and isn't too much work, though it is a bit hacky.
